name: More Fractured Pairs, a Trio, and a Quartet Quiz | Brain Teasers | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
rock and roll.

	"Just let me hear some more rock and roll music, any old time you choose it!" --Lennon/McCartney

hamburger and French fries.

	C'est  tres calorique. Remember Freedom Fries? (What a silly notion!)

raining cats and dogs.

	I have four cots and one dock. Two of my cots, Katrina and Beausoleil, are Katrina survivors that I adopted in November of 2005. In late August of 2005 that hellcat Hurricane Katrina rained cats and dogs and worse on the poor Gulf Coast (Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama).

wash and dry.

	When we were little our mom used to give us those little Wash 'n' Dry packets to clean our sticky little hands with. I loved the smell of those.

mix and match.

	MiGs (Russian fighter planes) were named so for the Mikoyan-Gurevich plane design bureau.

land and sea.

	"One if by land and two if by sea." Or was it vice-versa? Paul Revere's co-conspirator used lanterns in a tower to signal the Redcoats' mode of travel inland from Boston, Massachusetts. (The Redcoats were your ancestors, Brits! Probably some of them were my ancestors, too, since my family hadn't yet made it to North America.)

hearts and flowers.

	That reminds me of some dreadful song lyrics from the 1970s: "Sunshine, lollipops, and rainbows--everything that's wonderful is what I feel when we're together!" By Lesley Gore.

bacon and eggs.

	Cholesterol City! "A Man Called Gannon" was a 1969 Western with Anthony Franciosa.

under lock and key.

	Ghee is clarified butter. They use it in East Indian cooking.

questions.correct: knives forks and spoons & knives fork and spoons
questions.explanation:
knives forks and spoons & knives fork and spoons.

	When I used to set the table as a kid, I thought of the spoon as Olive Oyl, the fork as Popeye, and the knife as Brutus. Remember Wimpy the hamburger glutton?

slice and dice&slice and ice.

	Wasn't there a labor-saving device called Slice 'n' Dice (or something similar) that had an absolutely lethal blade?

stand and deliver.

	That's what masked highwaymen demanded of unfortunate coach travelers whom they stopped and robbed on lonely backroads. If you didn't "deliver" your purse and jewelry, you faced death.

pen and paper.

	Sadly, letter writing by hand is fast becoming a lost art.

John Paul George and Ringo.

	"I know I'll never lose affection for people and things that went before. I know I'll often stop and think about them...." --Lennon/McCartney
